entries.meaning: The vertical clearance above someone's head, as in a tunnel, doorway etc.
The vertical measurement, top to bottom, for example for clearance under a bridge.
(electronics) The ability of a system to reproduce loud sounds free of distortion; dynamic headroom.
examples: […]  the difference between signal-to-noise ratio and overload reserve (headroom) as well as noise (safety) margin (footroom).

entries.meaning: The distance between the actual performance of an algorithm and its maximum possible performance.
